#summary Bugs in Chrome/Chromium which are affecting features and/or performance

* [http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=16482 Chromium Issue #16482]
  * <video autobuffer> not respected

* [http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=16735 Chromium Issue #16735]
  *  HTML 5 Video Full screen - Feature Enhancement 

* [http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=16735 Chromium Issue #17765]
  *  html5 video tag and 1080p or 720p h264 needs dxva support!
  * (Hardware acceleration for video playback)

* [http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=19113 Chromium Issue #19113]
  *  Scaled HTML5 video loses quality
  *  (no interpolation is currently being applied when scaling video up or down)

* [http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=20187 Chromium Issue #20187]
  *  scrubbing low quality
  *  (seeking through the video with the time slider is jumpy and unpredictable)

* [http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=20274 Chromium Issue #20274]
  *  Videos without durations only play a single frame 
  *  Affects video formats where FFmpeg won't return the duration (i.e., flv)
  *  May be preventing use of "standard" and "high" (.flv) formats on YouTube

* [http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=21305 Chromium Issue #21305]
  * HTML5 video elements do not have an indication of loaded percentage/parts in the time slider widget
  * video.buffered may not be returning accurate or useful information until this is fixed
